00198 cr_id_t cr_get_id( void ( *pFunc )( void ) ) {
00199   int32_t i;
00200   cr_id_t id = CR_INVALID_ID;
00201 
00202   for ( i = 0; i <= cr_g_thread_cnt; i++ ) {
00203     if ( cr_g_context[ i ].pFunc == pFunc ) {
00204       id = i;
00205       break;
00206     }
00207   }
00208 
00209 //  printf( "cr_get_id pFunc: 0x%X\n", pFunc );
00210 //  printf( "cr_get_id id: %d\n", id );
00211 
00212   return id;
00213 }

00219 void cr_reset( void ) {
00220   cr_g_context    = 0;
00221   cr_g_context_cnt  = 0;
00222   cr_g_thread_cnt   = CR_THREAD_CNT_INIT;
00223   cr_g_previous_cr_id = CR_INVALID_ID;
00224   cr_g_current_cr_id  = CR_INVALID_ID;
00225   cr_g_activate_id  = CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID;
00226   cr_g_sys_started  = false;
00227 }

00238 void cr_init( CR_CONTEXT* cr_context, size_t cr_context_count ) {
00239   // Init the array of CR_CONTEXT structs as well as the globals.
00240   assert( cr_context && "user param cr_context must be non-zero!\n" );
00241   assert( ( cr_context_count > 0 ) && "user param cr_context_count must be non-zero!\n" );
00242 
00243   memset( cr_context, 0, cr_context_count * sizeof( CR_CONTEXT ) );
00244 
00245   cr_g_context    = cr_context;
00246   cr_g_context_cnt  = ( uint32_t ) cr_context_count;
00247 
00248   // Register the idle thread, which should _always_ be the first coroutine registered.
00249   cr_register_thread( cr_idle );
00250 }
00251 
00261 void cr_idle( void ) {
00262   // This needs to be static because the function initially returns normally.
00263   static cr_id_t temp_id;
00264 
00265   CR_THREAD_INIT( );
00266 
00267   assert( ( this_id__ == CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID ) && "cr_idle: this_id__ != CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID!\n" );
00268 
00269   // This will be the entry point when longjump is called with cr_idle's context.
00270   // No need to perform another setjmp from within the loop; not much happening.
00271   for ( ; ; ) {
00272     // Spin until a non-idle thread is activated.
00273     if ( cr_g_activate_id == CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID ) {
00274       continue;
00275     }
00276 
00277     assert( ( cr_g_activate_id != CR_INVALID_ID ) && "cr_idle: cr_g_activate_id == CR_INVALID_ID!\n" );
00278     assert( ( ( uint32_t ) cr_g_activate_id <= cr_g_context_cnt) && "cr_idle: cr_g_activate_id out of bounds!\n" );
00279     assert( ( cr_g_activate_id != this_id__ ) && "cr_idle: recursive coroutine call!\n" );
00280 
00281     temp_id     = cr_g_activate_id;
00282     cr_g_activate_id  = CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID;
00283     cr_g_previous_cr_id = CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID;
00284 
00285     if ( !setjmp( cr_g_context[ CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID ].env ) ) {
00286       longjmp( cr_g_context[ temp_id ].env, SETJMP_DFLT_RET_VAL );
00287     } else {
00288       /* explicit block for the longjmp */ ;
00289     }
00290   }
00291 }
00292 
00307 cr_id_t cr_register_thread( void ( *pFunc )( void ) ) {
00308   // Increase the coroutine count.
00309   cr_g_thread_cnt += 1;
00310 
00311   if ( cr_g_thread_cnt == CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID ) {
00312     if ( pFunc != cr_idle ) {
00313       perror( "cr_idle error: cr_g_thread_cnt != CR_IDLE_THREAD_ID. Note, coroutines shouldn't be registered prior to calling cr_init." );
00314     }
00315   }
00316 
00317   assert( pFunc && "cr_register_thread: pFunc is invalid!\n" );
00318 
00319   // Account fot the cr_idle coroutine (one reserved index in the array) in the assert check.
00320   assert( ( cr_g_thread_cnt < cr_g_context_cnt) &&
00321     "cr_register_thread: [ cr_g_thread_cnt < cr_g_context_cnt ] failed\n" );
00322 
00323   // Assign the coroutine's ID and function pointer to its context structure
00324   cr_g_context[ cr_g_thread_cnt ].id  = cr_g_thread_cnt;
00325   cr_g_context[ cr_g_thread_cnt ].pFunc = pFunc;
00326 
00327   // cr_g_current_cr_id is used by the CR_THREAD_INIT macro to identify
00328   // the coroutine.
00329   cr_g_current_cr_id = cr_g_thread_cnt;
00330 
00331   if ( !setjmp( cr_g_reg_func_env ) ) {
00332     pFunc( ); // this function won't return normally
00333   } else {
00334     /* explicit block for the longjmp */ ;
00335   }
00336 
00337   // The function is now a coroutine.
00338   // This is where we return from CR_THREAD_INIT via the longjump.
00339 
00340   // A sentinal. At init the coroutine returned via a longjump so the return
00341   // point saved in the function's prolog is valid and will return here
00342   // should the coroutine actually return normally via the epilog code.
00343   if ( cr_g_sys_started == CR_SYSTEM_STARTED ) {
00344     // What to do?
00345     // - nothing and return normally
00346     // - yield to whatever is in cr_g_previous_cr_id
00347     // - yield to cr_idle
00348     // - assert
00349     // - exit
00350 
00351     // Note, cr_g_current_cr_id holds the ID of the exiting coroutine.
00352     // Note, cr_g_previous_cr_id holds the ID of the previous coroutine.
00353 
00354     // Note, it's not possible to remove the exiting coroutine from the
00355     // context array because the remaining coroutine ID's cannot be changed,
00356     // a coroutine's ID is the index into the context array.
00357 
00358     // Look at the cr_g_current_cr_id variable in a debugger to see the ID
00359     // of the exiting coroutine.
00360     assert( CR_ERROR_CR_EXITING && "cr_register_thread: coruotine exiting!\n" );
00361 
00362     // Pass EXIT_SUCCESS; we want any user registered clean-up functions to be called.
00363     exit( EXIT_SUCCESS );
00364   }
00365 
00366   return cr_g_thread_cnt;
00367 }
